name: Arkham
description: A quiet, brooding town in Massachusetts, home to the infamous Miskatonic University. Visitors are advised to avoid the Restricted Collection in the Orne Library.

name: Innsmouth
description: A decaying seaport known for its unsettling locals and the pervasive, fishy odor that hangs in the air. The Gilman House hotel offers lodging, though sleep is seldom restful.

name: Dunwich
description: A destitute and remote village in the hills, haunted by a history of strange occurrences. The locals are insular, and the whippoorwills' calls at night are said to capture the souls of the dying.

name: The Sunken City of R'lyeh
description: A cyclopean, non-Euclidean metropolis that briefly surfaces from the Pacific depths when the stars are right. Its green, slimy monoliths are not meant for mortal eyes.

name: The Plateau of Leng
description: A cold, desolate plateau in Central Asia, said to be inhabited by inhuman entities. Time and space are known to warp in this forsaken region.

name: The Forbidden Lands
description: A vast, uncharted territory beyond the Sentinel Peaks, where twisted, ancient forests conceal secrets best left undisturbed.

name: Miskatonic University
description: The academic heart of Arkham. While the public-facing campus is quaint, the true knowledge lies in its hidden archives, which hold forbidden tomes like the Necronomicon.

name: The Witch House of Salem
description: The actual historic house of witch trials judge Jonathan Corwin, now a museum. It is rumored that certain artifacts within whisper secrets on moonless nights.

name: The Nameless City
description: A ruin buried by the sands of the Arabian desert, far older than mankind. Low, moaning winds are said to be the voices of its long-dead reptilian inhabitants.

name: Ulthar
description: A quaint town across the river Skai where, by ancient law, no man may harm a cat. The feline population is unusually intelligent and watchful.

name: The Mountains of Madness
description: The highest mountain range on Earth, located in Antarctica. Its peaks hide the ruins of a pre-human civilization and the shapeless horrors that destroyed it.

name: The Dreamlands
description: A vast, alternate dimension accessible only through slumber. Seasoned dreamers can visit wondrous cities or fall prey to unspeakable Night-gaunts.

name: Y'ha-nthlei
description: An undersea city inhabited by the Deep Ones, located off the coast of Innsmouth. Accessible only to those who have undergone a... transformation.

name: The Well of Whispers
description: An ancient, moss-covered well in the heart of the Arkham woods. Those who listen closely can hear fragmented prophecies, at the cost of their own pleasant dreams.

name: The Shadowed Reef
description: A jagged coral reef near Innsmouth, marked by an unnatural, oily iridescence. It is the focal point of the town's unsettling rituals.

name: Celepha√Øs
description: A breathtaking city in the Dreamlands with turquoise temples and galbanum-scented gardens, ruled by the dreamer Kuranes. A rare point of beauty.

name: The Unseen University of Arkham
description: A clandestine offshoot of Miskatonic, focused on the practical application of esoteric arts. Its curriculum is dangerous and its faculty, unnerving.

name: The Black Goat's Glade
description: A clearing deep within the Arkham woods where dark rituals are held under the new moon. Marked by a single, ominous black monolith.

name: The Isle of the Damned
description: A remote island perpetually shrouded in fog. Its shores are littered with shipwrecks, and strange, fluting music can be heard from its interior.

name: Kingsport
description: An ancient seaport town in Massachusetts known for its misty cliffs and colonial architecture. It holds a strange festival around the winter solstice.
